Class ExchangeManager

java.lang.Object
  ExchangeManager

public class ExchangeManager
extends java.lang.Object

The ExchangeManager class implements the whole process when received an order, including execute order and add order if necessary. The ExchangeManager class includes methods for processing an order, and for output the state of all the books in the exchange.

Author:
yixia

Constructor Summary
ExchangeManager()
           
 
Method Summary
 void printState()
          Print the state of all the books in the following format: price, bid/ask, size, where price is to two decimals places and size is an integer.
 void processOrder(Message message, boolean print)
          Process a new order, first check empty book situation, then execute the new order, and add to corresponding book if necessary.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

ExchangeManager

public ExchangeManager()
Method Detail

processOrder

public void processOrder(Message message,
                         boolean print)
Process a new order, first check empty book situation, then execute the new order, and add to corresponding book if necessary.

Parameters:
message - received order
print - signal for output, true for output (runner) and false for no output (silent runner)

printState

public void printState()
Print the state of all the books in the following format: price, bid/ask, size, where price is to two decimals places and size is an integer.
